definition: branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Hu Shi's value system of scientific education was characterized by pure science.
sentences.chinese: 胡适的科学教育价值观是以惟科学主义为特征的。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Nietzsche was firmly against Scientism.
sentences.chinese: 但是，尼采坚决反对唯科学主义。

sentences.english: Scientism is a major part of modem western philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 科学主义是现代西方两大哲学思潮之一。

sentences.english: These victories has also produced the viewpoints of Scientism.
sentences.chinese: 这些胜利也催生了唯科学主义的观点。

sentences.english: Scientism is a social thought that takes science as only and tiptop standard.
sentences.chinese: 科学主义是一种视科学为唯一与最高标准的社会思潮。

definition: materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4
